definitions.definition: suitable for or typical of a work of literature

examples.text: It was Chaucer who really turned English into a literary language.

definitions.definition: liking literature very much; studying or writing literature

examples.text: She was one of the great literary figures of her age.

wordOrigin: mid 17th cent. (in the sense ‘relating to the letters of the alphabet’): from Latin litterarius, from littera ‘letter of the alphabet’, (plural) ‘epistle, literature, culture’.
